title: House Panel Votes to Hold William Barr in Contempt Over Mueller Report
summary: 'We've talked for a long time about approaching a constitutional crisis-we are now in it,' the panel's chairman says. WASHINGTON-The House Judiciary Committee voted to hold Attorney General William Barr in contempt as the Democratic-led chamber and President Trump continued along a collision course over special counsel Robert Mueller's report.

title: Mixed Verdict in College Basketball Bribery Scheme
summary: Aspiring agent and former consultant convicted on bribery counts, acquitted on fraud charges that portrayed universities as victims. An aspiring sports agent and a former consultant for Adidas AG were found guilty of bribery charges Wednesday, in a scheme to pay college basketball coaches to steer star players to sign with a fledgling sports-management company.

title: Redfin to Let Home Buyers Make Offers Via Website
summary: Direct-purchase option would cut some real-estate agents out of transactions. Real-estate broker Redfin Corp. will allow visitors to its website to make an offer on a house with a click of a button, marking a renewed effort to reduce the role of real-estate agents.

title: Discord Hits Festival Marking Woodstock's 50th Anniversary
summary: Festival owner and producer engage in turf battle with financial partner-clash that could result in event's demise. Earlier this year, when organizers announced plans for a 50th anniversary edition of Woodstock, the 1969 landmark rock festival in upstate New York, they hailed it as a chance to celebrate the event's spirit of harmony and compassion.

title: San Francisco Investigates Doctor Over Measles Vaccination Exemptions
summary: City attorney issues subpoena for patient records of Dr. Kenneth Stoller, an opponent of vaccination requirements. SAN FRANCISCO-City officials here are investigating whether a pediatrician illegally gave medical exemptions to parents seeking to not vaccinate their children for school entry, as the U.S. struggles to get control of a growing measles outbreak.

title: Cuomo's Trump Bill of Attainder
summary: Albany Democrats want to release the President's New York tax return to Congress.. If Donald Trump's claims of executive privilege are a threat to the Constitution, as his critics now claim, what are we to make of the unprecedented bill of attainder against Mr. Trump now moving through the New York Legislature? Every President in memory has claimed executive privilege, but New York Democrats want to hand over the state tax returns of one man, the U.S. President, to Congress.

title: Airbnb Helps Slay Inflation
summary: Tech gets more out of economic resources, bringing prices down.. Why is inflation still so low? Because the economy is enjoying a positive supply-side shock, and it's not going away soon.

title: Huawei Executive Seeks Dismissal of U.S. Extradition Request
summary: Lawyer for CFO Meng Wanzhou says arrest violated her rights and Trump comments were political abuse. VANCOUVER, British Columbia-Lawyers for senior Huawei Technologies Co. executive Meng Wanzhou told a Vancouver court they would ask it to dismiss the U.S. request to have her extradited, saying the U.S. interfered in the case politically and Canadian border officials violated her rights.

title: Fire in New York Public Housing Kills Six, Including Four Children
summary: Cause appears to be accidental, authorities say. A fire in a Harlem apartment that killed six people, including a mother and her four children, started on a kitchen stove, then quickly spread and blocked their access to the front door and fire escapes, New York City officials said.

title: Two State Lawmakers Revive Push to Allow Online Sports Betting
summary: Democrats say they have a way around New York Constitution's ban on gambling. A pair of state lawmakers renewed their push to legalize online sports betting in New York, but they still face questions about whether such efforts are prohibited by the state's constitution.

title: Judicial Border Epiphany
summary: The Ninth Circuit finally decides not to add to the immigration mess.. Could it be, by some miracle, that anti-Trump judges are recognizing that their hijacking of immigration policy is contributing to the mess at the U.S.-Mexico border? That's the hopeful way to read the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals decision late Tuesday to stay a district court injunction against the Trump Administration for returning asylum applicants to Mexico while they await a hearing.

title: Bipartisan Help for Military Spouses
summary: A new Senate bill would encourage state occupational-licensing reform.. Kim Lopez has been a teacher for more than two decades. But as the wife of an Air Force service member, she struggles to maintain her career because of the complex requirements for out-of-state teaching licenses to be recognized. Mrs. Lopez has active licenses in California and Virginia, but she's relocated nine times and has had to fight through red tape with each move.

title: Netanyahu and Jewish Destiny
summary: Israel's prime minister was once a moderate. Will he now lead the right to the Promised Land?. After a resounding victory in the Israeli election, Benjamin Netanyahu is now free to continue forging the destiny of the Jewish people. A look at Mr. Netanyahu's early political views offers revealing insights into his evolution from a fence-straddling moderate to the guardian of the right who promises to annex parts of the West Bank.

title: History's Precedents for the 737 MAX
summary: Boeing isn't the first manufacturer to miss critical problems when certifying a new aircraft.. Frenzied headlines aside, the recent Boeing 737 MAX crashes fit a long pattern in the imperfect history of aircraft-certification programs, which sometimes miss fatal flaws.

title: So It's Trump vs. Biden in 2020?
summary: It looks like Democratic voters want plain-vanilla Joe Biden to contest the election against Donald Trump.. Joe Biden has opened up a 21-length lead over the 20 or so other ponies running to challenge the big horse, Donald Trump, in the 2020 presidential derby.

title: Sinclair Revenue Rises as It Bets Big on Sports
summary: The television station owner reached a deal last week to buy 21 regional sports networks from Disney. Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc. posted stronger revenue in the latest quarter as the television station owner looks to its purchase of a suite of sports networks to bolster its business.

title: Republicans Need a Health-Care Offensive
summary: Jobs won't be enough to win in 2020. The GOP must challenge Democratic strength.. It's the paradox of success. With 3.6% unemployment and 3.2% growth in gross domestic product, voters are turning to other issues. When the May 1 NBC/Wall Street Journal survey asked what "should be the top priority for the federal government," 24% chose health care and 18% said immigration and border security. Job creation and growth came in third, at 14%. While this shouldn't stop Republicans from selling their economic success, it points to a central challenge for 2020.

title: 'Jump-Starting America' Review: Investing in the Brain
summary: The economy at present appears to be strong. Would more public and private expenditure on education and research help it grow faster?. The unemployment rate may be under 4%, but parts of our economy are still rotten. Over 10% of prime-aged American men have left the labor force entirely, and they are typically worse off than the "unemployed" who are still looking for work. Robert Gordon's book "The Rise and Fall of American Growth" (2016) showed that the annual real growth rate of output per hour fell from 2.8% between 1920 and 1970 to 1.6% since then. The economists Ian Hathaway and Robert E. Litan have also documented a striking decadeslong decline in American entrepreneurship: Between 1978 and 2011, "the firm entry rate-or firms less than one year old as a share of all firms-fell by nearly half."

title: Erdogan's Obvious Insecurities
summary: The Turkish strongman loses an election but then gets a do-over.. Turkey's democracy has taken a beating in recent years, and on Monday it absorbed another blow. The country's national election board announced an arbitrary do-over of the Istanbul mayoral election, after President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's Justice and Development Party (AKP) suffered an embarrassing defeat.

title: The Job Advice You Wish You Knew How to Give
summary: Times have changed so much that parents puzzle over how to guide their sons and daughters toward a career. Nearly two million students will emerge from U.S. colleges with bachelor's degrees this year.

title: Walmart Store Managers Make $175,000 a Year on Average
summary: Retailer said its hourly workers make average of $25,000 in report seeking to rebut criticism that its pay is too low. Walmart Inc. outlined average wages for its store workers and efforts to improve benefits in a social responsibility report, part of the retailer's long-running efforts to rebut criticism of its pay and bolster its competitive position in a tight labor market.

title: Uber Set to Price IPO at Midpoint of Target Range or Below
summary: Investors like SoftBank Group still stand to reap major windfalls. Uber Technologies Inc. is on track to price its initial public offering at the midpoint of its target or below, according to people familiar with the matter, following a big stock-market drop and the disappointing debut of rival Lyft Inc.

title: IBM Completes $20 Billion Bond Sale
summary: Trade fears are doing little to stop U.S. companies from borrowing in the bond market. International Business Machines Corp. sold $20 billion of bonds Wednesday to help fund its purchase of Red Hat Inc., adding to a busy week for corporate-debt issuance a day after Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. sold $19 billion of bonds to finance its acquisition of Celgene Corp.

title: Atlassian CIO Makes Diversity a Priority
summary: Archana Rao says 'diversity in thought' brings better business decisions, problem solving. Diversity among information-technology employees is critical for companies undergoing major transitions, as well as high-growth businesses, said Archana Rao, chief information officer of business-productivity software maker Atlassian Corp.

title: Tottenham Stuns Ajax to Advance to Champions League Final
summary: With a second-half hat trick completed in the 96th minute, Lucas Moura carried Spurs to an all-English final against Liverpool. AMSTERDAM-This was the Champions League season where leads came to die.

title: Booming Disney's Streaming Picture Is Still Fuzzy
summary: The entertainment giant beat consensus estimates and showed off rapid growth at Hulu, but more evidence is needed to keep the stock's rally going. Walt Disney is coming hot on Netflix 's heels. Its stock has risen 22% since the beginning of the year.

title: U.S. Tightens Iran Sanctions After Tehran Warning
summary: Measures targeting industrial-metals sector follow Rouhani administration's warning that it may ignore limits on stockpiling materials in an effort to pressure Europe to aid its economy. The White House expanded its pressure campaign against Iran by imposing sanctions for the first time against its industrial-metals sector, hitting one of the largest nonpetroleum segments of Iran's economy just hours after Tehran warned it may restart parts of its nuclear program.

title: Mom Killed in Harlem Blaze Known as Loving Cook
summary: Andrea Pollidore specialized in Trinidad cuisine and brought meals to needy, her sister says. The mother who died in a Harlem apartment fire with four of her children and a family friend loved to cook and often brought meals to the needy, her sister said Wednesday.

title: EQT Moves to Replace Three Long-Serving Directors Ahead of Shareholder Vote
summary: Natural-gas producer also renominates Daniel Rice as it faces his brothers in a proxy fight. EQT Corp. is replacing three of its longest-serving directors as it heads into a proxy fight with two brothers who want to take over running the natural-gas producer.

title: Dollar Strengthens as Trade Concerns Persist
summary: Increase in odds that the U.S. and China won't resolve their trade dispute has affected currencies around the world. The U.S. dollar strengthened Wednesday, with investors becoming increasingly pessimistic about the chances of a trade agreement between the U.S. and China.

title: Fox Profit, Revenue Rise in First Quarter Since Spinoff
summary: Strong performance in cable, broadcast TV units drove higher profit following spinoff from 21st Century Fox. Fox Corp. said its profit rose in its first quarterly earnings report since being separated from 21st Century Fox, driven by stronger performances in its cable network and broadcast TV segments.

title: Brazil Central Bank Says Economy Still Exposed to Uncertainty
summary: Balance of risks calls for leaving Selic rate unchanged at 6.5%, bank says. SÃO PAULO-Brazil's central bank kept its benchmark lending rate unchanged Wednesday amid sluggish economic growth and expectations of slowing inflation.

title: Drivers Lead Protests Ahead of Uber IPO
summary: Demonstrations underscore risks faced by ride-sharing companies and others in the gig economy. Drivers for ride-sharing companies protested Wednesday, saying companies such as Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. have failed to pay drivers a living wage.

title: North Dakota's Triangle Petroleum Files for Bankruptcy
summary: Bondholder J.P. Morgan Securities to take ownership of oil-and-gas fracker. Triangle Petroleum Corp. , which has interests in North Dakota's energy and commercial real-estate markets, filed for bankruptcy Wednesday with a reorganization plan under which bondholder J.P. Morgan Securities LLC will get all of the equity.

title: Donald Trump Jr. Is Subpoenaed by Senate Committee in Russia Probe
summary: Panel led by Republicans wants testimony about earlier responses to investigators. WASHINGTON-The Republican-led Senate Intelligence Committee in recent weeks subpoenaed Donald Trump Jr., the president's eldest son, to testify about answers he gave congressional investigators as part of their Russia probe, according to people with knowledge of the matter, marking the first time a congressional panel has subpoenaed a member of President Trump's family.

title: Delays to Brazil's Pension Overhaul Increase Economic Concerns
summary: Analysts slash growth forecasts as lawmakers hold up bill to close gap consuming $60 billion a year of taxpayer funds. BRASÍLIA-Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro's slow-moving effort to get a pension overhaul approved in Congress has left the country's already struggling economy in limbo as businesses, consumers and markets wait to see when, and in what form, the proposal will finally be approved.

summary: Remarkable courage stops the carnage.. Amid the heartbreak resulting from recent school shootings comes news of exceptional bravery displayed by students.

title: S&P 500 Falls Again as Uncertainty Over Trade Talks Simmers

title: South Africans Vote in Election That Tests Mandela's Legacy
summary: The African National Congress has been in power for 25 years but corruption and inequality cloud its popularity with young voters. Millions of South Africans headed to the polls Wednesday amid growing disillusionment over steep racial inequalities that persist a quarter-century after Nelson Mandela became the nation's first black president.

title: U.S. Border Patrol Reports Another Surge of Arrests at Southern Border
summary: Rise in arrivals of immigrants traveling in families continues, with many coming from Central America and seeking asylum. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Border Patrol arrested 98,977 people crossing the southern border without authorization in April, the Trump administration said Wednesday.

title: Disney Spends Big on Its Streaming Bet
summary: Revenue rises as do content-production costs. LOS ANGELES-Walt Disney Co. shareholders on Wednesday got a glimpse of the expenses coming to the company as it readies the launch of its streaming service in November, but it nonetheless beat Wall Street expectations for its fiscal second-quarter financial results.

title: GE Investors Approve Executive Pay, Reject Independent Chairman
summary: Both measures draw significant opposition; CEO says company would consider clawbacks if misconduct found. TARRYTOWN, N.Y.- General Electric Co. shareholders approved the company's executive-compensation plans and rejected a proposal to appoint an independent chairman, but both measures garnered high levels of protest votes after two difficult years for the conglomerate.

title: Bolsonaro Further Eases Brazilians' Access to Guns
summary: New rules boost access to foreign-made firearms and ammunition and raise limits on how much ammunition a gun owner can purchase. BRASÍLIA-New rules relaxing gun-control laws took effect in Brazil on Wednesday, boosting access to foreign-made firearms and ammunition, raising limits on how much ammunition a gun owner can purchase and letting gun enthusiasts carry loaded weapons to shooting clubs.

title: Oil Rises on Falling U.S. Supplies, Trade Optimism

title: Flying Coast-to-Coast Nonstop Has Rarely Been Cheaper
summary: Competition among five airlines serving New York, California and other coastal destinations means deals even in high travel season. From Los Angeles, a flight to New York is sometimes cheaper these days than a flight to Chicago, even though it's 2½ hours longer. From Boston, you can fly 2,611 miles to Los Angeles cheaper than 91 miles to Nantucket.

title: More Career Advice for Recent Graduates
summary: Wall Street Journal readers join Work & Family columnist Sue Shellenbarger in offering advice to recent college graduates for entering a changing job market.

title: Copper Falls as China Worries Linger
summary: Prices have trimmed much of their 2019 advance in recent days. Copper prices fell again Wednesday, dropping on continued worries about trade tensions and a slowdown in Chinese economic growth.

title: Adjunct Professors Struggle as Colleges Prosper
summary: The grad students and other poorly paid instructors aren't being paid poorly because the tuition dollars aren't flowing in. Where is all the money, including government grants, being spent?. Regarding Barton Swaim's review of Herb Childress's "The Adjunct Underclass" (Bookshelf, May 2): A suggestion to the talented graduate students who love teaching-seek out jobs in high schools. Qualified and dedicated teachers of English literature are in high demand in the private and parochial schools with which I am familiar. Teaching upperclassmen in high school can be extraordinarily rewarding (not that different than college freshmen) and the pay much exceeds college adjuncts'.

title: Lawmakers Differ on Remedies for Facebook Privacy Breach
summary: At hearing, Democrats lean toward giving FTC more authority to police companies' privacy practices. WASHINGTON-A consumer-data privacy breach by Facebook Inc. is spurring Congress to rewrite rules for how tech companies safeguard personal information, but a hearing with regulators Wednesday highlighted the hurdles ahead.

title: The Ex-Im Bank Helps Small U.S. Businesses
summary: Bringing the Ex-Im back to full functionality is the right thing for the U.S. economy and for our workers.. Your editorial "Honey, We Shrunk the Ex-Im Bank" (May 2) claims that "nobody outside Washington noticed" the debilitated state of the Export-Import Bank since 2015, and that "no one seems to have suffered" from it. The fact is that American businesses across the country noticed, and their workers and their families are the ones who have suffered. President Trump realizes how crucial Ex-Im is to these businesses and their workers and families, and he has been a strong proponent of Ex-Im as a result.

title: $2 Trillion Infrastructure Plan Has Some Problems
summary: Politicians should stop touting the number of jobs various programs might create. The U.S. economy has already created more jobs than there are workers.. Regarding your editorial "$2 Trillion From Whom?," (May 1): You quote Sen. Chuck Schumer and Speaker Nancy Pelosi as saying "infrastructure is about creating jobs immediately." From what I read and hear, we already have a surplus of job openings, but not enough workers with the right skills or desire to take the available jobs. Given all this, politicians should stop touting the number of jobs various programs might create. The U.S. economy has already created more jobs than there are workers.

title: Trump Claims Goal Was to Show Deep Losses for Tax Purposes
summary: Comments come after report found Trump paid no income tax in eight of 10 years in the '80s and '90s. title: Tinder Ghosts the Stigma of Online Dating
summary: The younger demographic of Match Group's Tinder is sexing up online dating. Online dating is no longer a hard sell. That is a good sign for Match Group , whose biggest brand Tinder is, as the kids say, "so hot right now."

title: Maui: A Discriminating Insider's Guide
summary: How to conquer Hawaii's second-largest island and bypass all the usual tourist tedium? Follow these locals' tips to the best beaches, forest hikes, sunset cruises and our chef's favorite poke bowls. YOU FIND A LOT of oddball pairings in Maui, which looks like a small and big island clumsily glued together. Visitors compare ritzy beach resorts as feverishly as they do roadside banana-bread stands. The wealthy, omnipotent Oprah Winfrey runs a farm that supplies local restaurants with humble cabbage. And last winter, even as snow pelted the slopes of Haleakala for six straight days, nearby white-sand beaches steadily attracted sun-and-sea worshipers. Though change happens slowly on this development-resistant island, a few welcome additions are afoot. Chefs increasingly mine the state's varied culinary traditions instead of peddling macnut-crusted clichés, while revived interest in Maui's old sugar-plantation towns, such as Wailuku and Makawao, means more life-and chic shops-along the main streets. Here, locals share their favorite spots to stroll the sand, gobble fish burgers and spy on whales.

title: Google Struggles to Attract Paying Music Subscribers
summary: After several months of gains, search giant's music efforts have recently plateaued. Google's subscription music services are struggling to grow, almost a year into a revamp of its flagship YouTube Music, according to people with knowledge of its user numbers.

summary: Resume Subscription. It's 7 p.m. on a Saturday night and Yang Liu is whizzing around a T.J. Maxx store in New York City, filling her cart to the brim with cosmetics. "Oh my God," she says. title: The U.S. Economy Isn't Tariff-Proof
summary: The economy may be more vulnerable to higher levies on Chinese imports than the White House thinks. If President Donald Trump raises tariffs on Chinese imports, there is little doubt that the U.S. economy would take a hit. The question is how big the hit would be.

summary: Insurgents' assault on organization they said promotes Western values is likely to amplify concerns about commitments to human-rights gains as part of any deal to end 18-year-long war. summary: Varsity Spirit controller Jordan Olson shares how his love of cheer led him to college and a career. Cheerleading and accounting might seem an unlikely mix, but they've added up well for Jordan Olson.

title: Thai Leader Poised to Win Premiership After Opposition Falls Short

title: China Threatens Retaliation as U.S. Files Paperwork to Raise Tariffs

title: Count Goldman's Millionaire Clients as Big Winners on Uber

title: The Rage Behind Heart's 'Barracuda'
summary: Sisters Ann and Nancy Wilson say the 1977 hit was a furious response to sexism they faced in the music industry as the band's popularity soared. Outraged by record-industry sexism in 1976, Ann Wilson of Heart wrote a poem expressing the pain and humiliation of workplace harassment.

title: We Tested 50 Men's Hair Products. Here Are the Best.
summary: Though most fuzzy-haired fellas put some product in their hair, finding the exact pomade or wax that suits your needs can be maddening. We tried 50 so you don't have to. IN MY MIDDLE-SCHOOL years, filled with suburban tween angst, I began spiking my hair. It was my first stab at quasi-rebellion, one inspired by the Sex Pistols bassist Sid Vicious, whom I admired though he had died well before my birth. Each morning, I would squeeze out a dollop of cement-strength gel and mash it into my hair until I looked sufficiently electrocuted. I prided myself on the look (my first instant-messenger alias was Spikekid13), but I'd never style my hair that way today nor squirt that particular product into my hair. Gel is too gloppy, too glossy and too glue-like for my thick, straight strands, which I wear slightly up, slightly pushed to the side (think Armie Hammer's swoopy hair without the Hollywood polish).

title: Stop Wasting Money on Unnecessary Monthly Subscriptions
summary: That $10-a-month service you signed up for five years ago and rarely use? It's already cost you $600. Here's a hilarious story. For the past three years I've been paying $15 a month for an electronic fax service I've used... twice. That's $540. For the same amount, I could have bought 20 rolls of fax paper. Or 10 real working fax machines. Or a plane ticket to Ireland to visit the museum where the world's first fax machine is on display.

Elizabeth Warren plans to donate $4,500 to offset political contributions that her Senate campaign received over the years from members of the billionaire Sackler family that owns OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP, according to a Warren aide.

title: Bunge Revamps Leadership Under New CEO
summary: Agribusiness giant names new finance chief, swings to profit in first quarter. Bunge Ltd. extended its leadership revamp as its new chief executive seeks to make the 200-year-old agricultural company nimbler and more profitable.

summary: To rest, relax and wear a cool-mom single earring: that is the Mother's Day mandate. Or so says WSJ. Magazine's resident cool mom, Art Director Tanya Moskowitz. title: The New Rules of Middle Age, Written by Women
summary: Resume Subscription. Darcey Steinke knew she was going to write a book about menopause when she read that two of the only creatures to go through it are human women and killer whales. Instead of disappearing into the murky depths, she learned, the whales become leaders of their pods.

title: Kawhi Leonard Hibernated. Now He's Dominating.
summary: The Toronto Raptors paced him to peak in the playoffs. Is that what every NBA team should be doing?. When the Toronto Raptors traded for Kawhi Leonard last summer, they were making the kind of calculated risk that most professional sports teams prefer to avoid. Leonard was a superstar player entering the prime of his career, but he was also an enigma coming off an injury with one year left on his contract.

title: For Chinese Markets, There's No Such Thing as a Bad-News Day

title: Siemens, Moving to Avoid GE's Fate, Sheds More Businesses
summary: The spinoff is the company's most dramatic overhaul since it exited the telecommunications business in 2006. title: A New Fight Breaks Out Over 401(k) Fees

summary: If passed, they would diminish Hong Kong's reputation as a safe place for U.S. businesses, according to a group that advises Congress. HONG KONG-American national security and economic interests in Hong Kong face serious risks from proposed changes to the semiautonomous Chinese city's extradition laws, a U.S. commission said.

summary: The Japanese car maker proposes to use stock for a portion of pay to improve longer-term strategy and attract talent. TOKYO- Toyota Motor Corp. plans to make its top executives pay closer attention to the company's stock price.

summary: Drop in weekly storage fails to excite trading volatility as domestic drilling boom goes on. A gauge of U.S. natural-gas availability that used to be on every trader's desk is falling victim to surging domestic production.

summary: Resume Subscription. As the biggest fast-food chains have expanded menus to attract new customers, Chick-fil-A Inc. has gained ground with a different strategy: its focus on chicken sandwiches.

summary: Audits relating to Co-op's merger with Britannia Building Society fell short of expectations, Financial Reporting Council said. title: Regulator to Oppose TPG, Vodafone Hutchison Australia Merger

summary: Price of bitcoin and other digital currencies barely budged after the robbery was disclosed. Binance, one of the world's largest cryptocurrency exchanges, said hackers stole more than $40 million worth of bitcoin from its platform in what it called a "large scale security breach."
